The correct continuation, I will gain at least the Bishop pair.
Relatively best. Worse would have been 4... dxe5 5. Qxd8 Kxd8 Nxe5 where I would have gained a pawn and where Black King would have been stuck in the center.
Up to this point the game has followed the famous Morphy one. Here Black deviates from it with a worse move.

Up to this point the game has followed the famous Morphy one. Here Black deviates from it with a worse move.

This move removes mating threat but terribly weakens Black's Kingside and removes the most natural square for the development of his Knight. More natural would have been 6... Nf6, as in the above mentioned game, or 6... Qf6.
The final blunder, probably he hasn't seen the checkmate coming.
The final blunder, probably he hasn't seen the checkmate coming.
My first idea was Bxg8, winning a piece, but after a few seconds I saw Bf7. After this move checkmate follows: 8... Kd7 (or Ke7) 9. Qe6#.
